newsitem.title: USA: US Senate panel to vote on Pena nomination Feb 12.
newsitem.headline: US Senate panel to vote on Pena nomination Feb 12.

text.p: The U.S. Senate Energy Committee said Monday it was set to vote Wednesday on the nomination of Federico Pena to be Energy Secretary.
The committee is expected to approve the nomination, according to Energy Department officials.
Assuming it is approved, the full Senate could vote on it before the end of this week, according to Senate aides.
The committee is also set to vote Wednesday on a bill that could force the Clinton administration to build a temporary storage facility in Nevada for spent fuel from commercial nuclear reactors.
A similar bill was approved by the committee last year and was passed by the Senate by a vote of 63-37.
Undersecretary of Energy Thomas Grumbly reiterated last week that President Bill Clinton would veto the bill if it was passed without major changes.
